text: Aeacus was a mythological king of the island of Aegina in the Saronic Gulf. Aeacus was the son of Zeus and Aegina. When Aeacus died, he became one of the three judges in Hades. He assisted Poseidon and Apollo in building the walls of Troy and he had sanctuaries in Athens and Aegina. Category:Greek gods and goddesses
title: Aeacus
